title: Ticket #6586: Grid batch jobs can't be removed if submit fails
description:
If submission of a grid-type batch job to the local batch system fails, the job cannot be removed until a subsequent submission attempt succeeds.

This problem arises when the gridmanager picks up the job (say after being released from hold) and the GridJobId attribute is set with the gridmanager-assigned unique id but not an id from the batch system. If the job status is REMOVED, the gridmanager insists on submitting and then removing the job in the batch system before allowing it to leave the condor queue.
